RaceConfig.Description: Resoln is the settlement created by Relias on the eastern continent.
Resoln is the settlement created by Relias on the eastern continent.
Resoln is the settlement created by Relias on the eastern continent.

Kraxis is the land of traitors. Its people are mainly descended from the soldiers who comprised the Great Army of Mankind that marched on the Dread Lord Curgen's fortress at Imperium. They make their living dealing with the very Fallen who slaughtered their ancestors. The majority are settled in and around the port town of Tanacabra, on the Bay of Capacea.
Keepers of a deep motherload of iron ore.

AbilityBonusOption.Description: This faction starts with a handful of technologies.
Faction starts with the Restoration technology which allows them to build Apiarys, Orchards and Gardens as well as improving the amount of food grain provides

GameItemType.Description: This powerful potion not only heals the imbiber, but it removes any injuries a champion may have sustained from escaping from battle.

GameModifier.Provides: Removes all injuries champions have from escaping combat

GameItemType.Description: A revitalizing concoction of magical origin that can heal the wounded. Drink it to heal 60 points of damage.

SpellDef.Description: Turn mountain into hill; hill into land; but not land into water.
Heals target unit by 8 (+4 per life shard).
Heals target unit by 8 (+4 per life shard).
Summons a Titan from a distant world to fight for five turns.

AbilityBonusOption.Description: Allows the unit to cast Despair

GameModifier.Provides: Transfers 1 hit point per level from all enemies to the caster.

SpellDef.Description: Transfers 1 hit point per level from all enemies to the caster.
SpellDef.FormattedDescription: Transfers %d hit point per level from all enemies to the caster.

GameItemType.Description: A gift from the queen, this necklace the wearer's heal rate.
This bone charm increases the wearer's heal rate.
This bronze dagger is dull and worn but can still bite.

After the sacrifice of Red Spring, as the butchermen writhed upon their altars, Amhah called to Curgen. The titan never responded, the ritual was incomplete. Realizing his spell would never end Amhah turned his sword on himself, but it was too late. He is trapped as well.

GameModifier.Provides: +30% cumulative damage with each successful attack

GameItemType.Description: The poison that coats this blade it is only lethal when exposed to blood. Making the blade safe to handle, as long as you don't have any cuts on your fingers. (victims take 2 poison damage per turn)

GameModifier.Provides: Victims take 2 Poison damage per turn

GameItemType.Description: Sometimes wood is not the only thing that needs chopping.

GameModifier.Provides: Backswing- If the attack misses the unit gets a second attack against the same target
